Blue Taj is good for what it is.  With that said, this is definitely NOT an authentic Indian joint.  But I don't care.  It tastes good.  Having traveled to India and lived in Pakistan, I don't go to B.T. when I need my indian fix..... nope, that's when I cook.  But if I want a tasty meal - sure... why not?  The meat is always tender, the food is consistent and the portions are great for the price.  Service can be lacking at times but I usually get it to-go.  Overall, this place doesn't fullfill my cravings for Indian food but I definetely recommend The Blue Taj as a restaurant because hey - if it tastes good it tastes good!

Delicious! I love the salmon and lamb dishes. Their buffet on the weekends has a great variety and excellent flavor. The wait staff are enthusiastic and give great advice for helping choice a meal. They also know their food inside and out. I always come here with my Indian friends and try what they suggest. We all love it. You cannot go wrong with the Blue Taj!
Pretty good although consistency in service is an issue. Ive had horrible to great service, but I only go back to get my spice on!!!
The Sunday buffet is good, but inconsistent. Perhaps they have different chefs, not sure. But for the price it's not bad

Since Christmas is the busy season for a concert musician, we decided that the cooking of a huge Christmas dinner after a morning of work was just not on the table this year.  Luckily, Blue Taj was open on Christmas day, offering a full menu of Indian goodness.  We started our meal off with a mixed grill appetizer which included lamb, shrimp, beef, pork, and chicken two ways.  It was very tasty, though a little scant for the price.  However, dinner itself was superb.  Our waiter asked us our preference on level of heat--mild, medium, hot, or India hot.  We weren't up to India hot, but my saag paneer was nicely medium spiced and creamy.  My husband went a level hotter with the lamb kadai, which had lots of fresh vegetables and as the name would suggest, succulent lamb.  The garlic naan was buttery and toothsome, and we got a big bowl of rice for the table.  Gulab jamun for dessert--there were only two, but they were really good.  There was a bit of a wait for the food between each course, but it was Christmas day, and the tables were all filled, so that was likely the reason.  We plan to go back.

Delicious scrumptious Indian Food, the dishes are prepared with so much flavor, the mint chutney is thick and delectable (unlike many watered-down versions I've had in other Indian restaurants.)  The staff is friendly, service is quick and courteous but the food is the major winner!  Congrats on being successful, particularly because the location is slightly hidden from public view.

My wife had previously eaten here with someone who lived in India and let her know what to order so she wanted to take me. I would have been lost otherwise.  The ambiance was great inside and I liked the secluded seating throughout the restaurant. This is a great date place. Heads up, you get to choose the spiciness of your food. I I loved the spice level at three which wasn't too hot. In fact, next time I might go with a 4 for a little more kick. Everything was great, but I have to say the Chicken Tikki Masala was my favorite. We had the Chili Chicken for the appetizer and it was solid as well. I would definitely recommend this for an authentic Indian experience.

Went for a date night last night. Loud, over served regulars tried to get in a fight with a polite gentleman who asked them to try and limit their swearing. Then manager bought the regulars a round of shots. When this was mentioned to the staff. The response was " they're regulars, the other guy isn't" which was a very odd response in my opinion. Not going back.

This place is always money...if you are in the area and don't stop you are missing out. If you've never eaten Indian food and wanted to try this would be your entry point. Just be fore warned that you will measure every other place against them which you'll be back.

As an Indian, I normally can't justify going to a pricey Indian restaurant & paying for food that either I can cook at home myself or that my mom or an aunt can cook for me. But, in the last few months, I've found myself at Blue Taj twice (once with co-workers for lunch, and once for an anniversary celebratory dinner) Both times, I was impressed by the food, the ambiance and the service. I still believe it's expensive, and may be not entirely worth the money you pay , but it's not complaint worthy. It's worth visiting at least once, specially since I haven't found or heard of any other good Indian restaurants in the Charlotte area.

Ahhh indian food how i love you so. Blue taj does not disappoint, you know its decent when half the place is packed with indians. That said, they definitely use a bit too much cream in some dishes but everything from the ambience to the service to the actual food is spot on and definitely impressive for a city like charlotte. i also like the little outdoor mall its in, you can have indian, grab an espresso and even some dessert all in the same area, so thats key. definitely the only place i would go in CLT for indjun.
Good buffet. Paneer chilly was too good. Less number of dessert options for the buffet. No non veg biryani.

Had lunch today with a group of old and new friends. The food itself was delicious, portion sizes were fine, service wonderful and decor beautiful. However the price was ridiculous! To pay $4 for naan with a $15+ entry when it should be included. $5 for a mango lassi is overpriced.. And $15+ for a single entry of vegetable korma is overpriced for the portion size. I can understand $15 for curry goat, being that it's meat and not a common meat compared to cow, pig or chicken. I will not be returning unless it's for buffet or if I have a coupon.   FYI: They also add an 18% gratuity to groups of 5 or more.
Everything was five star from start to finish.   From the Tomato Coconut bisque to the Chicken Tikka Masala to the Mango Mousse dessert. Awesome! Best garlic naan and Chai Tea I have ever had.
Food wasn't all that great. Excellent ambience. But value for money is a little on the lower end.

Chicken Tikka Masala!!!! Get it. Just get it!! It is the beat dish I've ever had. I usually like butter chicken but they didn't have it here so I ordered the Chicken Leg Tikhad. It sure does have a kick to it!! I would have enjoyed it just fine if I hadn't tasted my boyfriend's Chicken Tikka Masala. I didn't even want to look at my dish after I took a bite of his. I was in awe when I took my first bite of his dish and was envious throughout dinner lol. He shared his but I knew I had to finish my own. On out second trip, we both got the chicken tikka masala and was very happy. Their naan is the best naan i've ever tasted. So fluffy, moist, and crunchy toasty on the bottom. It was good! We had to order two so we could finish as much of the Chicken Tikka Masala sauce as possible. The staff was very attentive and kind. They'll always get good tips! This is my new favorite Indian place and I recommend it to everyone.

I went here with a couple girlfriends and we had such a great time! The food was definitely on point and the staff was very friendly. Our waiter made a suggestion on a certain lamb we should try and it turned out to be my favorite dish(I don't remember what it was called sorry!) I would definitely go again and highly recommend it the only reason why I'm giving 4 stars is its a little pricy (the rice pudding was $4 and tiny, and no refills on the nan, entrees were a little pricy too). But overall loved it!

This restaurant is located on the lower level at Village of Ballantyne. It was my first Indian food experience And now I'm a huge fan! The server suggested a bottle of Malbec to go with the spiciness and it was SO good. The pita was so fresh and the best I've had so far. Loved the butter chicken. And the kabob appetizer.   The interior is beautiful. Date night material with a darker dining room, linen clothes, etc.

The staff is genuinely helpful and the food is most always on point. There has been some minor inconsistency with dishes, but when they're on, it's the best Indian food I've had to date. I feel their dinner service is better than during lunch and their vegetarian and vegan options are some of the best in the city. Highly recommended for dinner service although it is pretty dark and loud usually.

I had a business dinner last week at Blue Taj. I eat only vegan, whereas my associate does not. However, we both love great Indian cuisine.   We arrived with no reservation on a Thursday evening, around 8:00PM and were greeted quickly and cordially. We were seated within five minutes. The atmosphere was very nice, quiet and our table fairly private. The wait staff were attentive and knowledgeable. I mentioned my vegan requirements and suggestions were quickly made to accommodate me.  The food presentation was great. Plating was clean and simple, food looked great. But the best part of the taste and quality of the food. It was perfect in every way. Spices were exactly as ordered. Mine was modestly spicy. My table mate's was much hotter, as requested.   Vegetables were fresh, tender, cooked perfectly. The sauces were excellent. Our food was hot, but not too hot to enjoy immediately. Everything was delicious!  Prices were very reasonable and fair. Our overall experience could not have been better.  We both agreed that we would return to Blue Taj. And I would recommend the restaurant to anyone looking for excellent, authentically Indian cuisine and courteous service.

Some of the best food I've ever had in my life. Not just best Indian food, but food period.   The curry goat is phenomenal as well as the chicken tikka.   You have to get their coconut tomato soup.   I recommend going for lunch though, it's the best deal. You get soup, an entree and desert for $12 and it's almost as much as the dinner portion.   I highly recommend that you try this restaurant.

Went here on  Saturday night and it was packed!!  I felt the quality of the food lacked.  The chicken was more "tough" and the naan was burnt.  Also, the service was sporadic...we were either being bombarded or the girl was ghost or the one girl that was very available didn't speak english so she would have to go find someone to interpret what I was asking so that didn't help in terms of service.   The most disappointing aspect of dining here on the weekend is that they don't serve that little appetizer that most indian restaurants serve for free before the meal.  I have NO idea what the technical name is but it is like a thin cracker served with mango and mint chutney for dipping.  I was told that they don't offer that on weekends.  BOOO.  My tip---go to Blue Taj during the week.  I have been a huge fan of theirs but I was pretty disappointed by my first weekend visit.

We visited the Blue Taj Saturday night at 7:30, and it was very busy. We are from out of town and wanted to enjoy The Blue Taj again. This would be our third visit to this restaurant. We were delighted with appetizers of vegetable Somosa and cauliflower Marsala. Both had great flavors with a hint of heat. We then enjoyed the Kerala seafood and Rogan Josh as entrees. The Kerala seafood was just fantastic with it's slight sweet sauce. Then the Rogan Josh had tender lamb chunks in a rich and spicy sauce. Overall we loved our dinner, enjoyed the decor, the atmosphere, and menu choices. There is something for everyone, and the staff can make great suggestions for those who are new to Indian cuisine. Would recommend anyone to visit and look forward to visiting again.
Great food and atmosphere! Enjoyed the Chicken tikka masala (3 heat was just right if you enjoy spicy but not extra hot) served with rice; and an order of garlic Naan. Will definitely come again!

This place seriously if they keep up the quality and customer service is one of the best indian restaurant I have ever eaten a couple of the refreshing changes to old indian classics are amazing Kudos to these guys
Had Been there for weekend buffet , it was ok. Options were not great and saag was burnt ; when complained the server said that's the taste of veggies they added which was more confusing.

I was overall really impressed with the Blue Taj.  My boyfriend took me here on a date a while back and it was absolutely fantastic.  The atmosphere was very upscale but still cozy, the food was delicious, but what really made it for us was the service.  We made a reservation which I would recommend, and the service was amazing from the moment we walked in until we left.   I wish we could remember our server's name but it was forever ago.  He was so helpful (which is why I would definitely recommend this place to anyone unfamiliar with Indian cuisine but curious) and even suggested a dish that wasn't listed on the menu.  It was quite possibly the most delicious entree I've ever had.  Ever.  The Blue Taj is definitely an excellent date spot, however they did have accommodations for large parties.  I would recommend this restaurant for just about any occasion that calls for awesome cuisine and super friendly service.

Best Indian curries I have had outside of India. In fact, their chicken tikka and chicken tandi korma are absolutely delicious, make sure to get a 3 level spice if you can handle spice.   The best curry I had was in Mumbai based on a local friend's recommendation. That set a tremendous standard. I will say this, Blue Taj's curries have come very close to what I had in Mumbai. The curry was well-balanced, well-spiced, and appropriately flavorful. I know it has the same owners as Blue Taj, but it must be the chef or something because It's leagues beyond Copper in terms of authentic food quality and taste.  Truly the best Indian restaurant I've been to outside of India!

Sunday Buffet review only.  We decided to come here earlier today because there isn't that great of an Indian food selection near Carolina Place, we have heard Blue Taj is good (but pricey) and they offered a Sunday lunch buffet from 11:30a to 2:30p. The two of us walked in and were able to sit down right away, I would call in earlier for a wait time if you have a larger party. Lunch buffet is a little over $13 per person, our bill was $33 with tip. The ambiance is a little dark, they have a red curtain that is pulled out near the door to block the natural sun light.   I really enjoyed Blue Taj's buffet because of the quality of food followed by the selection.  Our favorite dish was the Chicken Tikka Masala, just as our fellow Yelpers have found. I must admit the Chicken Tikka had a great earthy flavor just as it should have but lacked heat. Very tasty dish and safe for those who don't like hot food. Actually, none of the buffet offerings were hot, just flavored with traditional Indian spices like cumin and coriander. I also enjoyed the chili lamb, it was especially succulent. The Shahi Paneer and fried Bhindi were also delicious. This was also the first buffet I have seen that included Gobi Manchurian, it wasn't as crispy as it would be right out of the fryer, made to order but, it was still somewhat crunchy, kudos. Dessert included a cream/fruit dish and Gulab Jaman, I didn't try the Gulab Jaman I wasn't looking for anything heavy after that meal. The fruit and cream salad was actually really refreshing and crisp with apples, bananas, grapes, melons, strawberries, and watermelon. It was the perfect end to a heavy meal.   I was not a fan of the Pav Bhaji, it looked right but didn't have flavor. I also didn't like the pakoras (possible attempt at Vadas), they were way too doughy. I did not attempt to take on the Pani Puri station, I was pretty much stuffed and looking for tea at that point.   The staff was very attentive, they quickly picked up empty plates and refilled water as expected. Definitely a very good experience. I won't come back for dinner service but count on me for weekday lunch and Sunday buffet. YUM.

I absolutely love this restaurant! My wife and I have been here probably 25 times and each time everything has been fantastic. The service is awesome the food is unbelievable and I enjoyed the experience each time. The ambience is very nice, they have just added some heated outdoor seating, and there is soothing music playing throughout.  I have had Indian cuisine in several cities and countries around the world, and have never been as happy with my meal as I am at The Blue Taj. I would highly recommend the chicken tiki masala or the lamb vindaloo. Make sure you make a reservation ahead of time, as this restaurant tends to fill up quickly.

Holy smokes...in all my years I have never had a restaurant fall so far so fast...I have eaten here for lunch a few times and had 4 to 5 star experiences...yes the dinner experience was that bad.   We came in tonight celebrating a family event, I made reservations for 4 people for 5:15 (cold and rainy day in Charlotte).  Before I start the review....for the love of all that is Holy..PUT SOME SLIDERS underneath your chairs...everytime someone moved their chair it sounded like nails across a chalkboard.  Service: At 5:05 we walked in..bar was open, one other table was seated, but hostess said they needed 10 minutes to get ready before we could sit as restaurant was not open.  My wife noted hey, it's freezing out there and instead of suggesting even waters at our table the hostess shrugged...we went to a different restaurant for a cocktail.  When we came back 15 minutes later, 4 tables were already seated.   We ordered a cocktail, and of course it was 15 minutes before we got it.  We were then given 3 menus, when we had 4 people .  We asked for a fourth menu and were asked why...your kids can share.  Really?  Even my kids were mad, their waters were never refilled, the waitress seriously grabbed the appetizer plates from underneath them mid bite.       Food: We had the Veg and non-Veg app, non veg was nice but overpriced....all the Veg was deep fried with little differentiation in flavor....  My wife ordered currry, and it looked like an oil slick...my lamb ven de alho was very good, except the rice they brought stuck together and looked like it was day old leftovers.  Both dishes were $17...again overpriced...and na'an was $6 even with 2 entrees.    I hardly ever give 5 stars, nor do I ever give 1 star...but what an incredible discrepancy.  Maybe I will try it again for lunch....but I will never come back for dinner.  My wife thought I was crazy for even recommending, and she is very easy to please.  I cannot remember a time when I just wanted dinner to be done with so I could get the heck out of a restaurant....  Net...food quality suffered tremendously, service was rushed and awful, food came out slow, ambience was incredibly bad....and $108 I will never get back.  Did I mention...PLEASE PUT SLIDERS ON THE CHAIRS...three Advils later and I'm still haunted by the noise!

Maybe we were there on a bad night?  Our first time there, and it was so highly recommended.  It was crazy busy, no problem.  We sat at the bar and had a couple of drinks while waiting for our table.  When our table was ready we closed our bar tab and went to the table.  It was insanely warm...like sweat dripping down our backs warm.  Our waiter was very nice and made recommendations. The waiter kept stopping by our table and apologizing and saying "only 5 more minutes...".  It took well over an hour to get our food.   Finally it arrived and while it was not bad, it certainly was not great.  Definitely not better than the much cheaper take out we usually order.  Then came the bill.  My husband noticed the drinks we had at the bar were on our table bill, even though we paid the tab at the bar.  My husband explained this to the waiter.  He then comes back with the manager who demands to see the receipt.  My husband pulls out the receipt to show him...it was very embarrassing.  Finally he agrees to take it off the bill.    Then, my husband hands the waiter his credit card to pay.  The guy comes back and hands it to my husband.  There is no place to sign.  When asked, he said it was because it was a "reprint" due to the drinks mistake.  My husband asked "ok, but it's paid right?" He says yes.  We leave.  We get halfway to our car and get chased by the waiter who says we have not paid our bill!  Granted...there is some language barrier here...but was hugely embarrassing.  The waiter was very polite and apologized over and over but the whole experience was pretty awful.    Between the heat, the mediocre food, and being embarrassed not once, but twice...I doubt we go back.  Two stars because the waiter was friendly and the appetizer was good.

If you're not familiar with the area or Ballantyne Village, it could be a bit hard to find. But if you park anywhere near Terrace Cafe, then follow the walkway to the right of it, it's right behind Terrace Cafe and the Escalators. You can also park in the Parking Deck and walk right up to it.   I came right after the lunch rush on a Tuesday so there wasn't a wait to be seated. The hostess greeted and seated me right away! I was also poured a glass of water immediately. I didn't need to scan the menu much because I already knew what I wanted but it's a pretty simple lunch menu with very reasonable prices. I ordered the Daily Express Lunch of House Spiced Curry with Chicken. He then asked me how spicy I wanted it which I thought was GREAT that I could use my own heat index. I said I wanted about medium heat spices and he understood. The Daily Express Lunch specials come with Naan and Rice with Soup or Salad. I opted for the soup of the day which was Tomato with Coconut Curry.  First up was my soup which came out quickly. First sip, melted my heart!!! It was absolutely delicious! Very smooth texture bursting with flavor and you can tasted all the herbs and spices in it. To be honest, I wanted more! My waiter came by and asked how I liked it, and I could barely look away from it to answer! Just as soon as I finished my soup, my lunch entree came out. A nice Bowl of the curry with just enough chicken, 4 pieces of Naan, and a large portion of Jeera Rice. I was pleasantly surprised!!! The Naan was soft and warm! I found myself dipping that in my curry as I ate. I'd never had Jeera Rice before but I loved it. It had a nice, light aromatic flavor cooked just right. Where it wasn't overly cooked and wasn't under. The curry was delicious! I wasn't sure what to expect when I ordered it but I just went with it and i'm glad I did! You could definitely taste all of the herbs and spices in it and they got my medium heat just right! I was so happy... then sad... because I got full only a few bites in lol.   Before I could ask, my waiter, whom had been very attentive and friendly the entire time, came and asked if I wanted a box, which I did of course! When he brought my box he explained how to box it. Was it necessary, no... but did I appreciate the extra concern to make sure I properly boxed my food to be able to enjoy it to it's fullest potential later.. DEFINITELY! He told me to pour my curry in the large section, the rice in both of the smaller section, and then take the bread with the paper holding it and place it on top. Great! No soggy bread here! He brought my check, I paid cash and I exited. Great meal at now my favorite Indian restaurant!!

Get the cauliflower appetizer.  It looks like cauliflower in tomato sauce, but the taste is excellent.  I enjoyed the amritsari chicken tikka.  So good, fresh chicken with veggies and a light sauce.  Would totally eat it over and over!

Stopped by this restaurant for dinner after flying into Charlotte Airport. The decor is lovely and the food is rich and on point. Service was great as well. I recommend the sweet lassi (I'm sure the other flavors are great as well). It was a little pricey for what we got but still a great spot to go to if you are craving (North) Indian food.

This is only the second time I've had Indian food let me start off with that. But, the food taste and quality was AMAZING! I'd only previously eaten at a great little Indian restaurant in NYC and that was phenomenal, but ,my only point of reference.  I'm happy to say that The Blue Taj was equally as impressive. Everything from the service level to the food's taste/quality to the ambience was top-notch. Our waiter was extremely helpful in answering our food-related questions and even made a few recommendations - both of which were spot on!  For an appetizer we shared the Chatpate Tikki Chole which are potato patties on a bed of seasoned chick peas with wonderful sauce poured over, with a crunchy flat bread to top it off. The flavors were wonderful and the potato patties were very well cooked, soft and flavorful.  Next up were the entrees. My wife ordered the Saag Paneer, which is one of the many vegetarian dishes they offer. Sautéed spinach and cream sauce cooked until it's almost like a porridge with chunks of homemade paneer (soft white cheese) which is flavored with fenugreek and is savory in every bite. I had the Chicken Tikka Masala, mild, and I was in love! The chunks of white meat, cooked to perfection in a bowl with the Masala sauce poured over stewing away with all those amazing middle eastern spices....my mouth is watering just thinking about it!  Both entries come with Basmati rice which is as delicious & flavorful as it is aromatic. Additionally, I recommend to anyone reading this to ask for an order of Garlic Naan. Naan is a flatbread that is fire-roasted and served up warm. The garlic version kicks it up a few notches, especially when you dip it into the variety of sauces served with each entree, it's to die for!  Finally, feeling extremely full but wanting to have a little something sweet, for dessert we ordered Malai Kulfi. Essentially this is Indian ice cream that is homemade with Saffron and Rose Water and is very creamy. I wasn't too impressed at first since it was still a little too cold to eat, but as it slowly set to room temperature, I was able to appreciate this as the perfect compliment to an Indian meal, especially since some dishes can vary in spiciness from none to extremely hot. The cream-base helped to dull to flame from the Tikka Masala and the honey-like flavor was a nice end to an incredible meal.
